location: The incident occurred at Creation Tendance Decouverte office.
summary: 01/09/2015: Two assailants stormed the offices of Creation Tendance Decouverte, a printing firm, in Dammartin-en-Goele town, Ile-de-France region, France. The attackers took one employee hostage during an eight-hour standoff with elite forces. The siege ended when the gunmen were shot and killed, while the hostages were released unharmed. The gunmen coordinated their attack with Amedy Coulibaly, the gunman who attacked a Kosher grocery store in Paris. The two assailants were identified as brothers Cherif Kouachi and Said Kouachi; they had carried out an attack two days earlier at the offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical magazine in Paris and security forces had been searching for them since.
weapdetail: Kalashnikov assault rifles were used in the attack.
propcomment: A printing firm office was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Charlie Hebdo attack: Three days of terror," BBC, January 14, 2015.
scite2: "Paris Gunmen Killed: Brothers Cherif And Said Kouachi Killed In Dammartin-En-Goele, Hostage Freed," Huffington Post Canada, January 9, 2015.
scite3: "I'm not a hero, says the graphic designer who hid in a box and texted police as Charlie Hebdo killers were holed up in his office," Mail Online, January 11, 2015.

location: The incident occurred in the Porte-de-Vincenne neighborhood.
summary: 01/09/2015: A single assailant stormed Hyper Casher, a kosher supermarket, in Porte de Vincenne area, Paris, Ile-de-France region, France. The gunman took the employees and customers hostage in a standoff against security forces, demanding that brothers Cherif Kouachi and Said Kouachi be allowed to go free. The brothers had attacked employees and police at the offices of Charlie Hebdo, a satirical magazine, two days earlier and were, at the time of the supermarket attack, involved in a standoff with police outside of the city. The supermarket siege ended when elite forces stormed the store, killing the assailant. Four hostages were killed, three people were injured and 15 hostages were released in the attack. The gunman was identified as Amedy Coulibaly; he pledged allegiance to the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in a video that was released posthumously.
motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that Amedy Coulibaly carried out the attack in order to negotiate the release of Cherif Kouachi and Said Kouachi.
weapdetail: Kalashnikov assault rifles were used in the attack.
propcomment: A kosher supermarket was damaged in this attack.
ransomnote: The assailant demanded that security forces allow Cherif Kouachi and Said Kouachi, who were involved in another hostage situation on the same day, to go free in exchange for the release of the hostages.
scite1: "Charlie Hebdo attack: Three days of terror," BBC, January 14, 2015.
scite2: "Paris gunman 'stopped' by police days before kosher store attack," France24, January 21, 2015.
scite3: "Two sieges come to a violent, bloody end," New Zealand Herald, January 10, 2015.

location: The incident occurred at the Stade de France.
summary: 11/13/2015: A suicide bomber detonated an explosives-laden vest near Gate D of the Stade de France, where a soccer match was taking place, in Saint Denis suburb, near Paris, Ile-de-France region, France. In addition to the suicide bomber, one Portuguese civilian was killed in the blast. This was one of eight coordinated attacks carried out by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in Paris on November 13, 2015. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for France's participation in the United States-led coalition that carried out airstrikes on ISIL targets in Iraq and Syria.

gname: Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL)

weapdetail: An explosives-laden belt was used in the attack.
propcomment: It is unknown if any property was damaged in this attack.
scite1: "Three Hours of Terror in Paris, Moment by Moment," The New York Times, November 15, 2015.
scite2: "Manuel Colaço Dias, sole victim of the Stade de France blasts," The Guardian (London), November 23, 2015.
scite3: "Paris terror attack: Everything we know on Saturday afternoon," The Telegraph, November 21, 2015.

summary: 11/13/2015: Three suicide bombers with explosives-laden vests opened fire on Bataclan concert hall, where an Eagles of Death Metal concert was being held, in 11th arrondissement area, Paris, Ile-de-France region, France. In addition, to the three assailants, 89 people were killed and at least 101 others were injured in the attack. Additionally, at least 20 civilians were taken hostage for at least two hours during the incident. This was one of eight coordinated attacks carried out by the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) in Paris on November 13, 2015. The Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant (ISIL) claimed responsibility for the incident and stated that the attack was carried out in retaliation for France's participation in the United States-led coalition that carried out airstrikes on ISIL targets in Iraq and Syria. (Note: Casualties Stephane Gregoire succumbed to his wounds on November 19, 2015, bringing the death toll at Bataclan to 90).

motive: The specific motive is unknown; however, sources suspected that the attack was part of a larger trend of violence against refugees in Europe.
propcomment: A hostel was damaged in this attack.
addnotes: There is doubt that this incident meets terrorism-related criteria. Sources stated that the assailant was heavily inebriated. Casualty numbers for this incident represent a division of a cumulative total of killed and wounded across incidents 201512240046 and 201512240047.
scite1: "German migrant crisis: Arson suspected in refugee home fires," BBC Online, December 24, 2015.
scite2: "12 Injured in Arson Attack German Town," Qatar News Agency, December 24, 2015.
